# NSDistributedLock

**Class**

A lock that multiple applications on multiple hosts can use to restrict access to some shared resource, such as a file.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSDistributedLock
```

## Overview

The lock is implemented by an entry (such as a file or directory) in the file system. For multiple applications to use an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDistributedLock] object to coordinate their activities, the lock must be writable on a file system accessible to all hosts on which the applications might be running.

Use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDistributedLock/try()] method to attempt to acquire a lock. You should generally use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDistributedLock/unlock()] method to release the lock rather than [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDistributedLock/break()].

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDistributedLock] doesn’t conform to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocking] protocol, nor does it have a `lock` method. The protocol’s [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocking/lock()] method is intended to block the execution of the thread until successful. For an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDistributedLock] object, this could mean polling the file system at some predetermined rate. A better solution is to provide the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDistributedLock/try()] method and let you determine the polling frequency that makes sense for your application.

## Creating an NSDistributedLock

- **init(path:)**: Initializes an `NSDistributedLock` object to use as the lock the file-system entry specified by a given path.

## Acquiring a Lock

- **try()**: Attempts to acquire the receiver and immediately returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the attempt was successful.

## Relinquishing a Lock

- **break()**: Forces the lock to be relinquished.
- **unlock()**: Relinquishes the receiver.

## Getting Lock Information

- **lockDate**: Returns the time the receiver was acquired by any of the `NSDistributedLock` objects using the same path.

## Threads and Locking

- **Thread**: A thread of execution.
- **NSLocking**: The elementary methods adopted by classes that define lock objects.
- **NSLock**: An object that coordinates the operation of multiple threads of execution within the same application.
- **NSRecursiveLock**: A lock that may be acquired multiple times by the same thread without causing a deadlock.
- **NSConditionLock**: A lock that can be associated with specific, user-defined conditions.
- **NSCondition**: A condition variable whose semantics follow those used for POSIX-style conditions.

## Inherits From

- NSObject
